snippet: One governor, Jeremy C. Stein, is stepping down on May 28, leaving three on the Board of Governors if no action is taken by the Senate on nominees.
abstract: Federal Reserve governor Jeremy C Stein is stepping down on May 28, leaving only three members left on the Board of Governors if no action is taken by Senate on nominees; dwindling of board is straining Fed's ability to manage its complex responsibilities and is also shifting balance of power onto Fed's most important group, Federal Open Market Committee.
lead_paragraph: One governor, Jeremy C. Stein, is stepping down on May 28, leaving three on the Board of Governors if no action is taken by the Senate on nominees.

headline.main: Vacancies Pose Threat to the Fed
headline.print_headline: Vacancies Pose Threat to the Fed
